708624f-a.title: Manhattan: 5th Avenue - 38th Street
708624f-a.text:
North on east side, of Fifth Avenue from 38th Street.
Union League Club at left centre.
Temple Emanu-El at extreme left.
1907.
Brown Brothers, Photographer.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

38th Street, north side, west from Fifth Avenue.
May 15, 1907.
Bhhown Brothers.

708626f-a.title: Manhattan: 5th Avenue - 38th Street
708626f-a.text:
North on Fifth Avenue from 38th Street.
March 22, 1935.
P.L. Sperr,Photographer.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

712490f-a.title: Manhattan: 38th Street (West) - 5th Avenue
712490f-a.text:
38, 40, 42-46, 48-56 West 38th Street, south side, between Fifth
and Sixth Avenues. No. 38, with the cafeteria on the ground
floor, is quite new; No. 4O is the last of a group of five
brownstone residences.
About 1922.
Apeda Studios.
Gift of E. M. Jenks.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.

730130f-b.title: General view - Midtown Manhattan - East 40s.
730130f-b.text:
General View Nidtown )anhattan, East 40's: View 1 shows
buildings under construction in the East 40's, as seen from
East 48th Street near Lexington 2venue. View 2 shows the sky-
scraper group in the sast 40's. From left to right they are:
New York Central (backaround), 10 East 40th -treet, the
Lincoln, -hrysler (not finisheC), Chanin, News, and Combustion
Engineering (extreme right) Buildings, seen from Broadwey and
34th treet.
View 3 shows the smae group of skyscrapers, seen from Sifth
Avenue and 38th -treet.
P. L. Sperr  View 1: Septaoer 5, 1928
NO REPPODUCTIONS  Views 2,3: 1930

708625f-b.title: Manhattan: 5th Avenue - 38th Street
708625f-b.text:
(1)
North on Fifth Avenue from 38th Street.
Note Union League Club at right, now demolished.
February 23, 1931.
P.L. Sperr,Photographer.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
North on east s ide of Fifth Avenue, from south of 38th
Street, showing razing of Union League Club.
May 15, 1932.
P.. Sperr,Photographer.
NO REPRODUCTITNS.
(3)
North on Fifth Avenue from south of 38tth Street.
Union League 9lub is marked Y.
It was built in 1883-84, and was demolished in 1932.
It was a staunch Tepublican Club.
March 10, 1929.
P.L. Sperr,Photographer.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

708628f-a.title: Manhattan: 5th Avenue - 38th Street
708628f-a.text:
The block bet. 39th E 40th Streets is to be demolished. Republic
National Bank home office, formerly the Knox Building is to remain.
A forty to fifty storey bldg is planned for the site.
Earl Christian, NNPL photographer
EE

708620f-a.title: Manhattan: 5th Avenue - 38th Street
708620f-a.text:
pifth Ave., east side, north from East 37th to 38th Streets. The
empty lot is at the N.E. corner of 37th Street.
About 1910.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.

708627f-a.title: Manhattan: 5th Avenue - 38th Street
708627f-a.text:
Fifth Ave., west side, north from and including West 38th Street, as
viewed from an elevated point midway between 37th and 38th Streets. Note
at the N.W. corner of 39th Street the 4-story Wendel House that has been
replaced by a low business structure. Several blocks northward appears
another structure that has been replaced; No. 500 Fifth Ave., at the
N.W. corner of 42nd Street (shown with sign thereon). The apparent gap
between these is occupied by the New York Public Library, which is receded
from the normal building line.
About 1928.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.

712487f-a.title: Manhattan: 38th Street - 5th Avenue
712487f-a.text:
38th Street, north side, east from Fifth Avenue.
May 15, 1907.
Brown Brothers.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

708623f-a.title: Manhattan: 5th Avenue - 38th Street
708623f-a.text:
Fifth Avenue, at, adjoining and north of the N. W. corner
of West 38th Street, showing the private residences that form-
erly stood here. This site in 1940 is occupied by the commer-
cial structure housing Lord \&: Taylors.
Note the curbstone advertisement reading ''For Congress
Wm. F. Dodge''.
About 1880's 7
American Studio, photo
87 Nassau St., N. Y. C.
Gift of Urbrock Collection
REPRODUCTION RIGHTS UNENOWN

712488f.title: Manhattan: 38th Street - 5th Avenue
712488f.text:
38th Street, south side, east from Fifth Avenue. Nos. 2 and 18 are
two-story stables. No. 12 is the residence of Mr. and Mrs. Charles
Scribner. At Madison Avenue may be seen the old Havemeyer mansion
at the S.W. corner and South Church (Dutch.Reformed) on the S.E.
Corner.
May 2, 1907.
Brown Brothers.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

712489f-a.title: Manhattan: 38th Street - 5th Avenue
712489f-a.text:
29, 27 West 38th Street, north side, between Sixth and Fifth
Avenues.
1910 or 1911.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.

712484f-a.title: Manhattan: 38th Street (East) - 5th Avenue
712484f-a.text:
10-8 East 38th Street, south side, between Madison and Fifth
Avenues. This picture is dated tentatively; it may have been
taken two years earlier when No. 10 was also temporarily vacant.
No. B, the boarded-up house, is the residence of Mrs. Jacob Wendell.
1V11.
MAY BE nEPRODUCED.
